metaData.title: Live as a local in Transylvania
metaData.text: Learn how to preserve the valuable hay meadows of Transylvania, wildlife and traditions by participating at the traditional hay making and cow hand-milking with the local farmers. Details here.

headline.title: Live as a local in Transylvania

specificArticles.text: In the last 2 weeks of August we invite you to connect to the life of the local farmers by taking part to the traditional hay making, cow milking and other household activities. Because the youths are moving to cities and some of the people were relocated by the Canadian mining company, the number of inhabitants and farmers has decreased. In order to take care of the hay meadows and to preserve the tradition of hay making, it would be really helpful for the farmers who are still living here to receive some help but this is also a great opportunity for nature lovers and those interested in traditional culture and sustainable living to learn about the connections between nature and farming and help to preserve valuable mountain hay meadows and their plant, wildlife and traditions. In the evening the host will make a traditional dinner as a reward and in one of the days we will go on a guided tour of the village to tell you more about the history and the local habits.

images.text: The hay is gathered into small hay stacks making it easy to transport.
The small hay stacks are transported with horses to a solid and flat ground where the big hay stacks are made.
Once the hay stack is made somebody has to climb on the top of it to put a hay crown.
In this way more and more hay stacks are made.
Hay making is also fun and educative for children.
The grass has grown so the field is ready to be worked.
Meanwhile the cows are grazing the fields all summer long and in the winter they will be fed with the hay.
In th evening learn or see how to hand-milk a cow.
In one of the days we will go in a guided tour of the village to tell you more about the history and the local habits.
The accommodation will be in private rooms with bathroom and kitchen access.

specificArticles.text: 'Hay meadows provide an immense range of benefits to farming communities and wider society. They create some of Europe’s most spectacular scenery and cultural landscapes. Simply to watch this natural, environmental and cultural heritage disappear before our eyes is, surely, not an option” said the Prince of Wales at the European Parliament, Brussels, 2012. Bellow you can see the video were Prince Charles speaks about the importance of hay meadows.

On the first day - check in, we get to know each other, see the field, share the hay activities.
Next days - we experience the traditional farm life by participating to the desired activities.
Last day - guided trail of the village.
You can come in any period from the last 2 weeks of August. The accommodation is in private rooms (with bathroom and kitchen) for 10€/person/night.
